articles.description: Reaction to the weekend's football, including Liverpool's win over Spurs in the Premier League and Chelsea thrashing Bristol City to keep their Women's Super League title hopes alive.
articles.title: Reaction: Liverpool beat out-of-form Spurs and Chelsea keep WSL title hopes alive

articles.description: Julen Lopetegui agrees a deal to become West Ham manager in the summer.
articles.title: Julen Lopetegui agrees to become West Ham manager

articles.description: Lando Norris' win in Miami was overdue and his talent has been clear for a long time, writes F1 correspondent Andrew Benson.
articles.title: Miami Grand Prix 2024: 'Lando Norris win well deserved as Red Bull turmoil continues'

articles.description: Captain Virgil van Dijk says he "loves" Liverpool and wants to be part of the club's transition after the departure of manager Jurgen Klopp.
articles.title: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk wants to be part of transition after Jurgen Klopp

articles.description: Referee Jarred Gillett will wear a video camera during Monday night's game between Crystal Palace and Manchester United.
articles.title: Crystal Palace vs Man Utd referee to wear camera in Premier League match

articles.description: Manchester City looked like they had one hand on the WSL trophy until everything changed against Arsenal.
articles.title: Man City defeat by Arsenal 'throws WSL title race up in the air'

articles.description: Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen thrash Eintracht Frankfurt to extend their unbeaten run in all competitions to 48 games.
articles.title: Eintracht Frankfurt 1-5 Bayer Leverkusen: Bundesliga champions thrash Frankfurt to remain unbeaten

articles.description: MOTD2 pundit Danny Murphy is impressed by Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah in Sunday's win over Tottenham, but says keeping him will not be the club's priority this summer.
articles.title: Danny Murphy column: Keeping Mohamed Salah not Liverpool’s priority
